intro: Alsomitra balansae, commonly known as the Balansae Alsomitra, is a climbing plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by dark blue berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
